listProblem.type: Usage of redundant or deprecated syntax or deprecated symbols
listProblem.comment: Elvis operator (?:) always returns the left operand of non-nullable type Path
listProblem.detailsInfo:
Reports obsolete language features and unnecessarily verbose code constructs during the code cleanup operation (**Code \| Code Cleanup** ).


A quick-fix automatically replaces usages of obsolete language features or unnecessarily verbose code constructs with compact and up-to-date syntax.


It also replaces deprecated symbols with their proposed substitutions.

listProblem.type: Usage of redundant or deprecated syntax or deprecated symbols
listProblem.detailsInfo:
Reports obsolete language features and unnecessarily verbose code constructs during the code cleanup operation (**Code \| Code Cleanup** ).


A quick-fix automatically replaces usages of obsolete language features or unnecessarily verbose code constructs with compact and up-to-date syntax.


It also replaces deprecated symbols with their proposed substitutions.

code.surroundingCode:
internal val PointerEvent.isShiftPressed: Boolean
    get() = mouseEvent?.isShiftDown ?: false

listProblem.type: Sealed sub-class without state and overridden equals
listProblem.comment: 'sealed' subclass has no state and no overridden 'equals()'
Accessing non-final property pluginId in constructor
Accessing non-final property pluginDescription in constructor
Accessing non-final property pluginClass in constructor

code.surroundingCode:
this.pluginId = pluginId
        this.pluginDescription = pluginDescription
        this.pluginClass = pluginClass
        this.version = version
        this.requires = requires

listProblem.comment: Accessing non-final property version in constructor

code.surroundingCode:
this.pluginDescription = pluginDescription
        this.pluginClass = pluginClass
        this.version = version
        this.requires = requires
        this.provider = provider

listProblem.comment: Accessing non-final property requires in constructor

code.surroundingCode:
this.pluginClass = pluginClass
        this.version = version
        this.requires = requires
        this.provider = provider
        this.license = license

listProblem.comment: Accessing non-final property provider in constructor

code.surroundingCode:
this.version = version
        this.requires = requires
        this.provider = provider
        this.license = license
    }

listProblem.comment: Accessing non-final property license in constructor

code.surroundingCode:
this.requires = requires
        this.provider = provider
        this.license = license
    }

listProblem.comment: Accessing non-final property dependencies in constructor

listProblem.detailsInfo:
Reports usages of an API marked with one of the annotations as unstable. Such an API may be changed or removed in future versions, breaking the code that uses it.

The annotations which are used to mark unstable APIs are shown in the list below.

By default, the inspection ignores usages of unstable APIs
if their declarations are located in sources of the same project. In such cases it'll be possible to update the usages when you change APIs.
However, it may be inconvenient if the project is big, so one can switch off the **Ignore API declared in this project** option to report
the usages of unstable APIs declared in both the project sources and libraries.
